groups.title: Standard Top Lead - importers for BBC homepage

items.headline: Farah wins gold as GB beat 2012 medal haul
items.summary: Mo Farah successfully defends his Olympic 5,000m title on a day when Team GB ensured they will leave Rio with a bigger medal haul than London 2012.

items.headline: Farah clinches Olympic 'double double'
items.summary: Mo Farah wins his fourth Olympic gold medal as he becomes the second man in history to retain the 5,000m and 10,000m titles.

items.headline: Walkden wins taekwondo bronze, Cho fourth
items.summary: Great Britain's Bianca Walkden wins bronze but Mahama Cho narrowly misses out on a medal in the taekwondo in Rio.

items.headline: GB women win bronze in 4x400m relay
items.summary: Great Britain's women claim bronze in the 4x400m relay to win the country's 66th medal of the Rio Olympics and surpass their London 2012 haul.

items.headline: Brazil beat Germany for Olympic gold
items.summary: Brazil beat Germany 5-4 on penalties to win their first men's Olympic football gold medal in dramatic fashion in Rio.

items.headline: Semenya wins Olympic 800m gold
items.summary: South Africa's Caster Semenya wins Olympic gold in the 800m as Great Britain's Lynsey Sharp comes sixth.

items.headline: GB's Adams retains Olympic title
items.summary: Flyweight Nicola Adams becomes the first British boxer to retain an Olympic title for 92 years by winning gold at Rio 2016.

items.headline: Heath wins gold in kayak 200m sprint
items.summary: Britain's Liam Heath secures his second medal at Rio 2016, winning gold in the men's kayak single 200m sprint.

items.headline: Daley eliminated in 10m platform semi
items.summary: Great Britain's Tom Daley fails to qualify for the 10m platform final at the Rio Olympics, finishing last in the semi-final.
